metadata.title: Allocating job losses: the mass layoffs at the Swedish Tobacco Monopoly in 1921

relevance.topic: Mass layoffs and labor displacement in the Swedish Tobacco Monopoly
relevance.relevance: The study is relevant as it examines the impact of technological change on labor displacement, specifically the introduction of cigar machines and its effect on layoff policies.

design.sample_characteristics: Workers at Malmo Cigar Factory, including both male and female workers, with a focus on those under 25 years of age.

dependent_variables.displaced: Workers laid off due to technological change and economic conditions.
dependent_variables.unemployment_or_underemployment: Layoffs affected young, female workers in April and older workers in October.

key_themes: Impact of technological change on labor
qualitative_data.narrative_descriptions: The study describes the shift in layoff policies at the Swedish Tobacco Monopoly in 1921, highlighting the abandonment of the seniority principle due to the introduction of cigar machines.

historical_context.economic_conditions: Recession and declining consumer demand for cigars in 1921.
historical_context.institutional_context: The Swedish Tobacco Monopoly was a state-owned enterprise expected to balance profit maximization with social responsibility.

outcomes.main_findings: The introduction of cigar machines led to a shift in layoff policies, abandoning the seniority principle in favor of other criteria such as performance and need.
outcomes.conclusions: Technological change reduced the need for experienced workers, leading to layoffs based on criteria other than seniority.

quality_assessment.methodological_limitations: The study relies on historical records and may not capture all informal practices.
quality_assessment.coherence: The study provides a consistent narrative supported by both qualitative and quantitative data.
quality_assessment.adequacy_of_data: The data is rich, combining qualitative accounts with quantitative analysis, but may lack comprehensive coverage of all worker experiences.
quality_assessment.relevance: The study is highly relevant to understanding the impact of technological change on labor displacement.
